reviewText: It is fascinating to me that a great photographer and political activist like Tina Modotti can also have been, however briefly, a movie star.  As those who have seen Edward Weston's portraits of her know, she was extremely beautiful and the feature film The Tiger's Coat shows that she had considerable screen presence.  Extras include a short biographical film (unsubtitled, but very clear if one has read Wikipedia) and many photographs of her and by her.
